body.p: The Board concluded that the IFRS benefits preparers and users of financial statements. This is because the accounting for joint arrangements in the IFRS follows a principle-based approach. This approach has allowed the Board to remove the accounting option in IAS 31 so that each type of joint arrangement (ie ‘joint operations’ and ‘joint ventures’) is accounted for on a consistent basis. This contributes to enhancing the verifiability, comparability and understandability of these arrangements in entities’ financial statements.
